title: North Definition & Meaning | Britannica Dictionary
text: Britannica Dictionary definition of NORTH 1 [noncount] : the direction that is to your left when you are facing the rising sun : the direction that is the opposite of south — see also magnetic north, true north 2 the north or the North : regions or countries north of a certain point especially : the northern part of the U.S. 2 north /ˈnoɚθ/ adjective 2 north /ˈnoɚθ/ adjective Britannica Dictionary definition of NORTH 1 : located in or toward the north - the north entrance/coast - North America 3 north /ˈnoɚθ/ adverb Britannica Dictionary definition of NORTH : to or toward the north - Turn north onto Elm Street. - It's a few miles north of here. - The bird is found as far north as Canada. up north informal : in or to the northern part of a country or region — compare down south at 3south
